choices: Give up making friends, and remain lonely
See if there is anyone in English class who's friendly.
Talk to her assigned counselor to get ideas.
1.content:
Denise tried to spark some type of conversation, especially with Janet and Marie. She didn't know these girls. Janet and Marie both looked to Diane for guidance, and fell silent.
It took about thirty minutes to arrive at the school. All the girls quickly exited the car, and were told by Corrine that they would be picked up in the same area at 3:00. Denise looked frightened and wanted some assurance. She slowly walked into the school, and proceeded down the stairs to the lockers. She found hers and opened it. This was the first time she had a locker to store her things in.
Denise looked at her watch, and realized she had to find room S-45, her home room. She found it, and there was Mary. sitting two rows away from her. Mary was very outgoing, while Denise was painfully shy. None of the other girls in the room struck up a conversation with Denise, so she just listened to the teacher, took some notes. looked at her schedule, and proceeded to find her English class. She wondered would she ever find a friend here, or would it be the four most boring years of her life.
What should she do next?
1.title: Breaking the Ice

choices: Find out what the rest of the day holds
See if she can talk to someone
11.content:
Denise decided that making friends was too much work. Now she will have to spend the next four years alone. She would give ANYTHING to find a friend. Someone she could confide in. Someone whose shoulder she could cry on.
Denise, so far, has made it through life friendless, and although it's been lonely, she is still here.
What should she do next?
11.title: Empty Days

choices: Offer any and all assistance
Point the girl to the Reception Desk
111.content:
The thought of spending the next four years in a all-girls school friendless was more than Denise could imagine. While she was walking down the halls, trying to find the rooms that her classes would be in, she was the one who would say hello before the other person had the chance.
          Since the color of the freshman uniform was brown, Denise decided to say hello to any and all freshmen she would come across. Soon after adopting this idea, a fellow freshman came up to her to ask for directions.


What should Denise do next?
111.title: A Surprising Day

choices: Be shy at the meeting
Try to be bubbly and outgoing
112.content:
Denise forgot that along with her schedule, she was given the name of a "big sister." Although she was the oldest in her family, having a "big sister" might be a pleasant change. She looked at the name:Cheryl Stevens. "Why does that name sound familiar?" she wondered. After racking her brain for a bit, she remembered that there was a Lisa Stevens in her English class. Could this girl be her real sister?
Also on the paper was an announcement for a "Big Sister, Little Sister" picnic scheduled for later that afternoon. The "Big Sisters" were to make lunches for their younger counterparts to make them feel welcome. The "Little Sisters" were the bring some type of small gift in return.
Denise was hoping that Cheryl would be a friend, as well as, an ally. She was willing to try new experiences, so meeting Cheryl and finding out about the ins and outs of school life would be a challenge she would welcome and relish.
How should she handle the first meeting?
112.title: Finding a new approach

choices: pee on herself
intimidated
other
1121.content: she was a bit shy to meet her big sister. how does she handle it ?
1121.title: Be shy at the meeting

choices: Make friends with her Big Sister
Fight and argue with her Big Sister
11211.content: Actually he doesn't that was what she was afraid would happen and it never does, however she does...
11211.title: pee on herself

choices: Speak with Mrs. Sill at the outset of the problem.
Wait until the end of class to approach the teacher
Ask the teacher if she can address the class to explain things.
12.content:
Denise arrived at her English class ten minutes early. She was trying to get a seat in the front. This was not for vanity or wanting to be a teachers pet. She didn't see that well, and needed to see the board.
The girls started coming in. Denise assessed each one to see if there was anyone she knew. She saw Susan, Vivian, and ChrisAnn. All three of these girls were former classmates of Denise's, and they didn't give her the time of day then. It seemed as if everyone was out to make her life miserable.
The teacher walked in. Her name was Mrs. Sill. She seemed friendly enough. Something sparked in Denise's memory. She looked at her schedule, and noticed that her Speech teacher was Mr. Sill. Could they be related?
Mrs. Sill started the roll call, and stated that everyone had to be seated alphabetically. This, for Denise, would be horrendous. She would have to sit in the back. After the roll, an assignment sheet was distributed and explained. Questions were taken and answered. Denise wondered how she should approach the teacher in regard to her eyesight problem. She knew this would make her an outcast immediately, and friendless for life. So she thought.
What should she do?
12.title: Going from bad to worse

choices: "Hi, Cecille, can I be your friend?"
Just ignore her and hope for the best.
"Uh...nothing?"
121.content:
"Ma'am?" Denise asked Mrs. Sill.

"Yes, Denise?" Mrs. Sill answered.

"I have an eyesight problem, and I need to be seated in front," Denise tentatively replied.

"Yes you may be seated in front, next to Cecille," Mrs. Sill told her.

Denise picked up her things and sat next to a green-eyed girl with cropped blonde hair and glasses. Apparently, Cecille also had an eyesight problem.

And also an anger management problem. She glared at Denise. "What are you looking at?"

What can you do?
121.title: Speak with Mrs. Sill at the outset of the problem.

1211.content: I am new to the area will you be my friend ? give my friends your skirt and underwear and we will have a deal.
1211.title: "Hi, Cecille, can I be your friend?"

choices: She is happy she talked to Mrs. Sill
She is EXTREMELY embarrassed she talked to Mrs. Sill
122.content:
"And that will conclude today's lesson, students," Mrs. Sill explained, and immediately after, the bell rang. Mrs. Sill went right over to her desk, and started looking at some papers.

Nervously and slowly, Denise walked up to Mrs. Sill's desk. She waited there to see if Mrs. Sill would notice her, and when she didn't, Denise decided to speak up. "Uhh, Mrs. Sill," she started, "I was wondering if I could ask you a question about the seating arrangement."

Mrs. Sill looked up from her papers. "The seating arrangement?" she asked, friendly enough, "Why, of course. Does it have anything to do with your hearing or eyesight or anything like that?"

"Well...umm...well--yes," Denise said with a little relief, and embarrassment at the same time.

"Don't worry about it, hon, it happens all the time," Mrs. Sill said, "How's the first seat, second row for you?"

Denise shook her head yes...
122.title: Seating Arrangement Change?

choices: The girl makes fun of her
The girl is friendly
1221.content:
Denise is grateful that she talked to Mrs. Still and that it went so smoothly. How did Mrs. Still know to ask if she had a hearing or sight problem?

Looking back at her schedule, she headed off to PE class. Next to lunch, this was the worst time of the day for her in the past, and she shuffled her feet along, pouting that she would have to go through the dreaded class again.

She went into the locker room, and while slipping into some soccer shorts, glanced nervously around the room to make sure that no one was watching her.

Someone was. A short, pudgy red-head with a shimmery mini-skirt and a tank-top with a plunging neckline was staring right at her. Denise's eye started twitching as the girl approached.
1221.title: PE locker room change

choices: Stand there and be interrogated by Gabby
Proceed to find the P. E. teacher to give her a note she has.
12211.content:
As the girl approached, Denise became very nervous. Should she be friendly, or pleasantly inform this girl that she is dressed inappropriately for a Catholic all girl high school.

          "Hi, my name is Gabby. What's yours?"

          "Denise. Why are you dressed like that? There is a dress code here."

          "I know, but the what the sisters don't know won't hurt them. Do you have something wrong with you? Why do you walk like that?"

What should Denise do?
12211.title: Name, Rank, and Shoe Size

choices: Should Denise make a run for it?
Should she give her mother's note to Gabby?
122111.content:
Denise looked at the girl and cocked her head to one side. "What?" she asked.

         "You hard of hearing?" said Gabby. "I said why do you walk like that?"

         Gabby moved in very close and Denise could smell bubble gum. Denise backed away and in a low voice said, "I've got to go find the PE teacher and give her a note. Do you know where I can find her?"

         "A note?" asked Gabby. "What kind of note?" Sneering, she reached her hand out, "Let me see it."

         Denise had her back to the lockers and Gabby was standing right in front of her. She was afraid that the much bigger girl would take her mother's note and show it to all the other girls. That would be the end of her ever making any friends in this school. She looked frantically from side to side and thought she make a dash down the line of lockers. Maybe she could make it out of the locker room before Gabby caught her.
122111.title: Stand there and be interrogated by Gabby

choices: We should partners in gym
you look weird
12212.content:
The red head walked right up to me and just stared. She didn't say anything at first. I tried to look straight ahead and to continue dressing but her stare was getting to me.

"Whats your problem?" I finally got the nerve to ask.

"Ah, nothing. Just thought... well never mind." Red head said and turned and walked back to the area in the locker she had been dressing in. I noticed her mini skirt was atleast one size too small. Her freckles clashed with the colors she was wearing. Now that I think about it, she looked like she was trying to fit in.

I finished dressing and walked right up to the short pudgy red headed girl.

"Never mind about about what? What were you going to tell me?
12212.title: The stare

choices: Asked Amanda to sit next to her.
Sat alone at lunch.
122121.content:
"I was just wondering if you wanted to be my partner in gym class" replied the red headed girl.
Denise replied "sure."
As Denise was walking out of the locker room the red headed girl followed. She explained that she had just moved here from North Carolina and didn't have any friends. She thought she was going to have a hard time making friends. Most of the students at her other school thought of her as an outcast. After talking most of gym, Denise found out that her name was Amanda and that she lived in the same neighborhood as Denise. She was headed to lunch and...
122121.title: Making a friend

1221211.content: So Amanda do you want to have lunch together ? Sure Denise but give me your clothes
1221211.title: Asked Amanda to sit next to her.

choices: embarassed
mortified
1221212.content: a bully came and said I hate that skirt, get rid of it now. Wait lose that damn blouse to sweet cheeks
1221212.title: Sat alone at lunch.

choices: The Library!
To the sports fields!
12212121.content:
Denise just stare at the bully with a glare and he feels a deep chill run down his spine. Something strange is going on and he wants nothing to do with it. He runs in terror and Denise tilts her head a moment later. She is staring at her food and realizes that she is completely alone. Deeply sorrowful, she sniffles and wonders why no one seems to like her. She realizes that sitting here alone will never help her to find a friend though. She knows she has to go to them. Her resolve building, she thinks as she eats faster. Nearly choking on her sandwich, she quickly drinks down her drink and then finishes. She will not let her fate end up like this. With renewed vigor she rises tall and turns to the clock. There is still plenty of time left, she can still find some friends. She thinks about where she might find some friends and two things come to mind. The smarter people, or at least the quieter and shyer types, would probably be at the library. The more outgoing kids would be outside, most likely by the sports fields. So which, will she go for, a quiet and shy, but kind friend. Or a more outgoing, more playful and more popular and outdoorsy sort of person?

She stand a moment and thinks, then, she heads to...
12212121.title: I think not

choices: She snaps and grabs up the bag,
She has had it and snaps around and tries to punch whoever it was in the face.
12212122.content:
Denise is mortified at what is happening and she wants no part of it. Luckily, the school happens to have a police officer and he happens to be walking through the cafeteria looking for just such an incident. He quickly snatches up the bully and begins to berate and lecture to him about the consequences of such actions and especially of threatening someone in a way that could turn into sexual assault. Denise is stunned, but grateful that at least someone care about her, even if it was only on a legal level. She sits there, staring at her sandwich and begins to wonder if she will ever find friends. Then, after what seems like a second, the bell rings.

"Wha...? How can lunch be over already?"

Denise looks more closely at her sandwich and realizes it has started to turn hard on the outside, she's been sitting there the entire hour, feeling aweful about herself and worried she will be alone the rest of her high school career. She begins to break down...but she has to get to class. On the other hand, she has no idea how she will react if something else bad happens to her.

She stands up and devours her sandwich, trying to salvage what is left of her meal. As she does though, she feels a hand begins to reach for her backpack, and begin to slowly pull it away from her.

She freezes a moment and considers what to do next.
12212122.title: Mortified

122122.content: You look kind of weird freak, the other girl says i want your clothes now
122122.title: you look weird

choices: no skirt
no blouse
123.content: You ask the teacher to address the class to be aware of her problem
123.title: Ask the teacher if she can address the class to...

choices: just missing her skirt
no skirt or panties
socks and shoes
1231.content: A girl walked up to and whispered in your ear i am sure you would look better with out this. The girl cut the strings keeping the threads attached to the buttons on her skirt. She was about to say something when the mean girl reminded her, she already took her skirt. Do you want to be noticed for lack of attire ? NO then you better hurry along to your class unless you want to give me more of your clothes fresh meat. This all happened two minutes before she needed to be in her class.How did the mean girl let her go to class ?
1231.title: no skirt

12311.content:
Luckily, Denise had thought ahead and pulled on an identical skirt after leaving the class. She does wonder what that girl's problem is and readies herself for any other jerks or perverts. However, she never has trouble with them again and eventually becomes valedictorian of her class, the prom queen for both her junior and senior proms, and meets the girl of her dreams and the best friends any girl could ever hope for and then went to college and got her dream job. It was all smooth sailing after that point because she met her best friend from then on out next class, and she inreoduced her to her friends and eventually her future boyfriend moved into town.

Remembering her hard first day at the school, she befriends him immediately. They become fast friends and eventually fall in love. He proposes to her after graduation and they all lived happily ever after until they died.
12311.title: just missing her skirt

choices: Please take your seat
Go straight to the principal's office
12312.content:
"Nope" Denise says as her neck extends to unnatural proportions before returning to normal. The mean girl goes running off in terror along with the rest of the class. Denise just chuckles and wonders why she bothered with normal humans anyway. She looks around the empty classroom and sighs. She pulls out a wand. With a quick cast of a spell, all of their memories of the incident are gone and she then casts a silent spell on herself that makes her an ordinary human girl, unless someone attempts something on that level again.

She looks around at the still empty classroom and wonders what is going on. Just then the class bell rings and she realizes, that she is late to next period. She quickly rushes through the halls to her next class. The room is a little noisy but a few people are staring at her. She teacher does not look amused and crosses his arms in judgement and says.

"Late I see...well, it is the first day so in that case..."
12312.title: no skirt or panties

choices: Creative Writing
Shop Class
12313.content: In other words, she gave Denise a spare identical skirt and gave her, her own socks and shoes then runs off into the crowd and is never heard from again. Denise stares at the scene in shock but wastes no time in slipping her skirt on and rushes off to class. She is excited about this one, it is her favorite. Which one was that again?
12313.title: socks and shoes

choices: you run to lost and found
head to principal's office
head to class without knowledge of it happened
1232.content: You have no blouse on any more because an aimless person pulled it off of you as you wore walking to class, which left you in your almost transparent skimpy halter top.
1232.title: no blouse

choices: Just an ordinary typical fire drill.
The fire is real and she is in danger of being trapped by the flames.
12321.content:
Denise runs to the lost and found, luckily that is right in the same room. She grabs up her blouse which, was sitting right on top. Mortified, but otherwise fine, she discretely slips it on and heads to class. Then suddenly a siren starts going off, it is the fire alarm. She thinks she can smell smoke, but with shop class next store it might just be that. Either way she knows she has to find her way out.

Is the fire real or is it a drill?
12321.title: you run to lost and found

choices: The note from the Principal.
The note from her mother.
12322.content:
Denise heads to the principals office. At first he is astounded and outraged to see the state of dress she is in. He immediately gives her a spare shirt they have, a not so great but okay shirt from school spirit day. However, after she begins to break down and explains what happened, he forgives her and looks outside his office. He mentions to a passing teacher what happened and they nod with a knowing glare and quickly retrieve the girl. The principal recognizes the girl immediately and he is not surprised it was her, she has always been a troublemaker. He demands Denise be returned her blouse. The girl's mouth drops in shock and infuriation, but she soon relents as the principal continues to raise the days in-school suspension she must serve. Denise thanks the principal and he smiles and says not to worry that she can count on him to be there for her.

She thanks him and hurries along to class with a note from the principal to her teacher explaining why he is late for class. She is grateful everything turned out alright, but now she is paranoid about what else people might try. She knows this won't help her get any new friends, but she can't help it, after all, if someone could just up and steal her clothing from right off of her...who knows what other twisted people are in the school.

She is thinking this over when she suddenly trips and falls, both of her notes fall to the ground. The one from her mother, and the one from the principal. She gasps and manages to scramble to pick one up. However, another student gets the other one and begins to look it over. Which one, does he have?
12322.title: head to principal's office

choices: A high-tech research facility that is far more advanced than a high school needs
A regular boing chemistry lab.
12323.content: Because it never happened! It actually turns out that the other girl was delusional and was known to blurt out about stuff like that. Denise hopes she is okay, but she shrugs it off as the teacher leads the poor insane girl to the school psychologist. Denise is more concerned about making friends and figuring out her schedule to have time to worry about a girl like that anyway. She looks at her schedule, and sees that her next class is Chemistry. She walks to room 104 which is labelled "Chemistry Lab" once inside she sees...
12323.title: head to class without knowledge of it happened

choices: See what materializes next.
Don't make friends at all.
13.content:
After Denise put her books in her locker, she viewed her schedule and noticed that she had some time. She went to the counselor's office to make an appointment with her assigned counselor. His name was Robert Brown.
Still trying to decipher her schedule, she tried to make an appointment during some of her free mods. She found three mods, and equivalent of forty-five minutes between noon and one. The appointment was made. She wondered what this counselor would discuss since she never had one before.
At noon, Denise went to Mr. Brown's office. He was busy with another student, so she waited. When she was ushered in, Mr. Brown introduced himself, and asked if there was anything he could assist her with. One of the issues Denise was concerned with was making friends. The only advice Mr. Brown would give on that subject was to be as friendly as possible. That didn't help.

What should she do next?
13.title: Counseling ?

choices: She continues kicking the wall.
She speaks to the tall girl.
Mr. Brown comes out of his office.
132.content:
Denise had expected the counsellor to have more concrete suggestions, and his seeming lack of support discouraged her. In a fit of moodiness, she decided she was NEVER, EVER going to make friends at this school.

Coming out of the counsellor's office, she did something she'd hardly ever done before. She vented her frustration by kicking on the wall. Once, twice. Felt good. Three times, four times. Harder, faster. Five, six, seven.

"I know. I've felt like doing that sometimes, too, coming out of that office. I think that patch of wall that's chipped away was made by students doing that."

Denise was so startled she almost fell.

She turned to find a tall, bespectacled girl looking down at her, smiling.

"So what's Mr. Brown doing to make you feel that way, huh?"

Denise wondered what to do. She had just resolved she'd NEVER EVER make a friend, after all.
132.title: Don't make friends at all.

choices: Blame the hole on the other girl
Run away alone, as fast as possible
Grab the girl and run away, so she dosn't get in trouble
1321.content:
Denise took a deep breath. The world was trying to trick her, this was just like her old school. Pretend the girl wasn't even there.

Ignoring the girl, Denise continued kicking the wall.

"Excuse me?" the girl asked. "You better stop it hun, we're going to get in trouble!"

"We are not doing anything" Denise snarled.

"Look I know you've had a rough day or whatever but-"

And then Denise's shoe broke straight through the foundation of the wall and into the shin of her principal, Pr. Riley.

Oh no! What should Denise do???
1321.title: She continues kicking the wall.

choices: Go on the tour with Brianna
Do not go on the tour with Brianna
1322.content:
Denise stared, unblinking at the girl for about 50 seconds, without responding. When she finally managed to speak, all she could sputter out was, "You have Mr. Brown, too?"

"Uhh, everyone in grade 9 does?" the girl responded. "My name is Brianna. Are you new here?"

"I'm Denise. And yeah, obviously. Let's just say things did not work out at my old school, and things seem to be going the same way here."

"Well, you only have been here for four hours, sooo..."

"Hey! I'm serious!" Denise raised her voice, only half-sarcastic.

"Okay, hun. Whatever you say. How about we both take a chill, ey? Do you want me to take you on a tour?"

What should Denise do?
1322.title: She speaks to the tall girl.

info.brief_description: Starting school can be horrendous and frightening.  How would it be dealt with?
info.description:
Denise was tentatively looking forward to her first day of school. She wondered how these new girls were going to react to and treat her. She wasn't treated well in her prior school, and hoped that here things would be different and better.
Since a bus didn't come close enough to her house, Denise's mother arranged a carpool comprised of neighborhood girls who would be also attending. There were sisters Mary and Diane who lived a block away. Mary was Denise's age while Diane was two years older. Another block away resided Marie, who was Diane's age. She was also Diane's best friend. Six blocks from Marie's house lived Janet, who was also the same age as Diane and Marie.
All four girls knew each other, and were indifferent to Denise and her mother, Corrine. During the drive to school, the girls chatted away, oblivious to who was driving and that they were receiving a ride. Corrine charged the girls $5.00 a week for gas to help defray expenses.
How should Denise break the ice with these girls?
Ask them how their summer was?
Try to get to know the girls she doesn't know that well?
